Switch a cubble object into the long form

Source: R/face-temporal.R
face_temporal.Rd

face_temporal() switches a cubble object into a long cubble, suitable for temporal operations. The long cubble uses the combination of key and index to identify each row and arranges each key as a separate group.

face_temporal(data, col)

Arguments

data

a nested cubble object

col

the list column to be expanded, col is required to be specified if there are more than one list column and the list column name is not ts

Value

a cubble object in the nested form

Examples

climate_flat %>%
  as_cubble(key = id, index = date, coords = c(long, lat)) %>%
  face_temporal()
#> # cubble:  date, id [5]: long form
#> # bbox:    [115.9764, -32.9342, 133.5407, -12.4239]
#> # spatial: lat [dbl], long [dbl], elev [dbl], name [chr], wmo_id [dbl]
#>    id          date        prcp  tmax  tmin
#>    <chr>       <date>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1 ASN00009021 2020-01-01     0  31.9  15.3
#>  2 ASN00009021 2020-01-02     0  24.9  16.4
#>  3 ASN00009021 2020-01-03     6  23.2  13  
#>  4 ASN00009021 2020-01-04     0  28.4  12.4
#>  5 ASN00009021 2020-01-05     0  35.3  11.6
#>  6 ASN00009021 2020-01-06     0  34.8  13.1
#>  7 ASN00009021 2020-01-07     0  32.8  15.1
#>  8 ASN00009021 2020-01-08     0  30.4  17.4
#>  9 ASN00009021 2020-01-09     0  28.7  17.3
#> 10 ASN00009021 2020-01-10     0  32.6  15.8
#> # ℹ 1,820 more rows
